thread.title: Nemacolin's Lautrec Restaurant again named to prestigious list
thread.title_full: Nemacolin's Lautrec Restaurant again named to prestigious list

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Nemacolin's Lautrec Restaurant again named to prestigious list
text:
Nemacolin's Lautrec Restaurant again named to prestigious list February 22, 2017 2:27 PM Bob Donaldson/Post-Gazette Lautrec restaurant Chef de Cuisine Kristin Butterworth at the Nemacolin Woodlands Resort in Farmington, Fayette County. Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Make it nine for five for Southwestern Pennsylvania’s most-regaled restaurant. 
For the ninth consecutive year, Lautrec Restaurant at Nemacolin Woodlands Resort in Farmington, Fayette County, has earned a prestigious five-star rating in the 2017 Forbes Travel Guide for its European-American fare and service. This year’s list includes just 62 Five-Star restaurants worldwide and only three in Pennsylvania. 
Under the guidance of executive chef and Pittsburgh native Kristin Butterworth, Lautrec is one of only 29 restaurants in the world to hold both the Forbes Travel Guide Five-Star award and the coveted AAA Five-Diamond award, which it again received earlier this year.
